text:
I quoted somebody in a comment of my build file
<!-- Du Klasse Y im package a.b.c suchst, dann muß (das verlangt Java, -->

and I got:
<<Buildfile: build.xml

BUILD FAILED
Error reading project file: Invalid byte 2 of 2-byte UTF-8 sequence.

Total time: 1 second>>
Suggestions: 
1) print the offending line number
2) print the offending character or the entire line

P.S.: The German "SZ" was it!   ;)

creator: bodewig@apache.org
text:
unless you say something else, XML documents must be in UTF8 encoding.
Ant can't do anything here as it doesn't even see the document, the parser aborts
parsing before Ant gets hold of it.

For the "unless you say something else" part see Ant's FAQ.

creator: hauser@acm.org
text:
thx, found the FAQ entry and added it to the URL field.

o.k., as per the stacktrace in -debug, this seems to be xerxes
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.io.UTF8Reader.invalidByte(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.io.UTF8Reader.read(Unknown Source)
        at org.apache.xerces.impl.XMLEntityScanner.load(Unknown Source)

==> moved bug to there since no similar bug when querying product xerxes-j

Now, also got
<<Error reading project file: Invalid byte 1 of 1-byte UTF-8 sequence.>>

Stefan, how about adding a hint in your FAQ about using "xmllint" to determine
where the problem is (at least for linux and cygwin users, that tool is readily
available)?
